name: help-scout-mcp-server
description: Connect Claude and other AI assistants to your Help Scout data with enterprise-grade security and advanced search capabilities.
long_description:
Connect your AI assistant to Help Scout for intelligent customer support analysis.

**Search & Analysis:**
• Advanced conversation search with query syntax
• Multi-status search across active, pending, and closed
• Boolean queries with content and subject filtering
• Conversation summaries and full thread retrieval
• Direct ticket lookup by number

**Enterprise Security:**
• OAuth2 Client Credentials authentication
• Optional content redaction for privacy
• Built-in caching and rate limiting
• Automatic retry with exponential backoff

app_id.title: Help Scout App ID
app_id.description: Your App ID from Help Scout My Apps

app_secret.title: Help Scout App Secret
app_secret.description: Your App Secret from Help Scout My Apps

default_inbox_id.title: Default Inbox ID (Optional)
default_inbox_id.description: Default inbox for scoped searches - improves LLM context. Inbox IDs are auto-discovered on connect. Leave empty to search all inboxes.

redact_message_content.title: Redact Message Content
redact_message_content.description: Hide message bodies in responses for privacy

cache_ttl.title: Cache TTL (seconds)
cache_ttl.description: How long to cache API responses

prompts.name: search-last-7-days
prompts.description: Find recent conversations from the last 7 days
prompts.text:
To search for conversations from the last 7 days:
1. Use getServerTime tool to get current timestamp
2. Calculate date 7 days ago
3. Use searchConversations with createdAfter parameter
4. Optionally get details with getConversationSummary or getThreads

prompts.name: find-urgent-tags
prompts.text:
To find urgent conversations:
1. Use getServerTime tool
2. Search for conversations with tags like 'urgent', 'priority', 'high-priority', 'critical'
3. Use searchConversations tool with tag parameter
4. Consider using getConversationSummary for quick assessment

prompts.name: list-inbox-activity
prompts.text:
To monitor inbox activity:
1. Use getServerTime tool
2. Calculate timestamp N hours ago
3. Use searchConversations with inboxId and createdAfter
4. Analyze results for activity patterns and status breakdown
